授業目的: This seminar-style course is focused on in-depth understanding and application of various methodological approaches (history, media studies, gender-studies/psychoanalysis, reception studies) in analysis of Japanese popular culture products such as manga and anime. Together we will read and discuss texts by Jaqueline Berndt, Azuma Hiroki, Thomas LaMarre, Mark Steinberg and others. Through reading and discussing the texts the students will gain the ability to analyze a media text.
到達目標:
Through a combination of seminar style discussions, student presentation, analysis of works, we will learn to apply a variety of methodological approaches to popular media texts.
Together we will read seminal texts on manga and anime and discuss them in class.
Students will be required to do a presentation of their own analysis of manga or anime work. Final assignment will be creating own derivative work and contextualizing it.
授業方法: The class will be conducted face-to-face in a designated classroom (subject to change). The  class will be delivered simultaneously two-way via ZOOM for students who have applied for online class participation.
